text: In Greek mythology, Molus (/ˈmoʊləs/; Ancient Greek: Μῶλος Molos means "toil and moil") was the son of Ares and Demonice, daughter of Agenor, son of Pleuron. He has three brothers namely: Evenus, Pylus and Thestius.Pseudo- Apollodorus, Bibliotheca, 1.7.7 == Mythology == Molus only appeared in Apollodorus, Bibliotheca where the scholar discussed the descendants of Aeolus, son of Hellen: > "And Agenor, son of Pleuron, married Epicaste, daughter of Calydon, and > begat Porthaon and Demonice, who had Evenus, Molus, Pylus, and Thestius by > Ares." == References == Category:Children of Ares Category:Deucalionids
title: Molus of Aetolia
